config_validation.methodology: Repeat rate as primary success metric per .cursorrules

description: Zone MVP criteria prioritizing SUCCESS METRICS (retention, satisfaction) over volume. Order volume is a survivorship bias metric - it shows activity, not success.

philosophy.principle: Success = families returning happy, not just ordering once
philosophy.warning: High order volume in a zone does NOT mean success - it may just mean the zone has more population or partners. Focus on repeat rate and satisfaction.
success_hierarchy: 3. Order frequency (how often do retained customers order?)
5. Volume (last - only relevant after above are healthy)

ftt_zone.description: Family Time (Dinneroo) zones - zones where Dinneroo is available
ftt_zone.note: WBRs reference 'FTT zones' for platform penetration calculations. The 3+ partner threshold is our internal definition for analysis scope.

repeat_rate_min.justification: 20% repeat rate is achievable (top 41% of zones) while still being meaningful. Validated: zones with 20%+ repeat rate have significantly better outcomes.
repeat_rate_min.change_reason: Updated 2026-01-06: 35% was unachievable (only 1 zone passed). 20% is evidence-based threshold.

rating_min.justification: 4.3+ rating shows statistically significant correlation with repeat rate (p<0.05). 4.5 threshold showed NO significant difference (p=0.21).
rating_min.change_reason: Updated 2026-01-06: 4.5 was not statistically meaningful. 4.3 is evidence-based threshold.

cuisine_count_min.justification: Cuisine count has STRONGEST correlation with repeat rate (r=0.514). Zones with 4+ cuisines have significantly higher repeat rates (p<0.001).

mvp_selection_requirements.description: ACTIONABLE requirements for what cuisines and dishes a zone needs. This is what AMs use to know what to recruit.

required.reason: Universal family appeal, high kid-friendliness, high volume
Highest repeat rate among major cuisines, excellent family portions
Top cuisine by volume, strong balanced meal perception
Balanced midweek meal positioning, customisable sides, kid-friendly protein
Second highest repeat rate, fresh/healthy perception, excellent ratings

recommended.reason: Above-threshold repeat rate, high customisation for fussy eaters

evidence.note: Low volume but strong repeat rate - growth opportunity

recommended.reason: Strong repeat rate, balanced meal perception, good veggie options
High repeat rate, fits balanced midweek positioning

not_recommended.reason: Below repeat rate threshold (17.9% < 20%), ranks #83/86 in dish priority scoring
not_recommended.note: Despite being 'kid-friendly', data shows families don't return for burgers. Does not fit balanced midweek meal positioning.

core_cuisines.note: Must have at least 5 of the above cuisines covered. All 5 'required' cuisines should be prioritised first.

priority_dish_types.description: These dish TYPES (not brands) should be available in an MVP zone. Check against menu catalog.

tier_1_essential.why: Perfect balanced midweek meal - protein + veg + carbs, kid-friendly, adult appeal
Great portions, mild options for kids, adults love it

tier_1_essential.dish_type: Pasta Bolognese / Pasta with Tomato Sauce

tier_1_essential.why: Balanced, customisable, works for whole family

tier_2_important.why: Good adult appeal, can be made mild

tier_3_nice_to_have.why: Weekend family meal, but can work midweek

priority_dish_types.mvp_requirement: Zone must have at least 3 of the 5 Tier 1 dish types available

zone_health_score.description: BLENDED score combining BEHAVIORAL data (what families do) with SURVEY data (how families feel). Triangulation provides more robust success signal.

approach.behavioral_data: Repeat rate, star ratings, order volume - shows revealed preference
approach.survey_data: Satisfaction rate, kids happy rate - shows stated satisfaction
approach.why_blend: Behavioral shows what families DO, survey shows how they FEEL. Together = complete picture.

repeat_rate.description: % customers ordering 2+ times. PRIMARY behavioral signal.

survey_satisfaction.description: How adults feel about the meal. PRIMARY survey signal.
survey_satisfaction.fallback: If survey n < 20, use star rating as proxy

kids_happy_rate.description: Kids eating it = family success. CRITICAL for Dinneroo.
kids_happy_rate.fallback: If survey n < 20, use zone average or 0.7 default

star_rating.description: Normalized star rating. Behavioral satisfaction proxy.

cuisine_coverage.description: 8 cuisines = full coverage for diverse families

volume.description: LOWEST weight - volume is an OUTCOME of success, not success itself

fallback_logic.description: When survey data is insufficient, fall back to behavioral proxies

interpretation.0.8_plus: Excellent - zone is healthy, focus on growth
interpretation.0.4_to_0.6: Developing - address retention or satisfaction gaps
interpretation.below_0.4: Needs attention - fundamental issues with selection or quality

supply_gap.definition: Cuisine has <2 partners OR dish type not available

quality_gap.definition: Cuisine available but rating <4.5 OR satisfaction <70%
quality_gap.priority: Medium - need to improve existing partners

mvp_ready.criteria: Has 4+ cuisines AND 3+ Tier 1 dish types AND 20%+ repeat rate AND 4.3+ rating
mvp_ready.action: Focus on growth levers beyond selection - marketing, frequency, AOV
checklist: ✓ Indian partner with mild curry options
mvp_ready.validation: 21% of zones (43/201) meet these criteria. Validated against repeat rate correlation.

near_mvp.criteria: Has 3-4 core cuisines AND 2+ Tier 1 dish types
near_mvp.action: Recruit 1-2 specific partners to fill gaps
example_gaps: Missing: Grilled chicken partner → recruit Nando's-style
Missing: Mexican partner → recruit burrito/taco partner

developing.criteria: Has 1-2 core cuisines OR missing multiple Tier 1 dishes
developing.action: Significant partner recruitment needed - prioritise Italian, Indian, Asian first

early_stage.action: Zone requires foundational buildout - focus on any family-friendly partners first

am_zone_checklist.description: Quick checklist for Account Managers to evaluate their zone
questions: 1. Do I have a pizza/pasta option? (Italian)
2. Do I have a mild curry option? (Indian)
3. Do I have a rice bowl option? (Asian/Japanese)
4. Do I have a grilled chicken with sides option?
5. Do I have a noodle/fresh option? (Thai/Vietnamese)
8. Do families have at least 3 different balanced midweek meal options?
